p: FTIR spectroscopic results are shown in Figure 6. MTX produced major distinguishing bands at 3,450 cm −1 (O-H stretching from carboxyl groups), 1,670–1,600 cm −1 (C=O stretching from carboxylic group and amidic group, so the band split into a doublet), 1495 cm −1 (N-H bending from amide group), 1,400–1,200 cm −1 (C-O stretching from carboxylic group), and 832 cm −1 (C-H - two adjacent hydrogens on aromatic ring, para substitution) ( Figure 6A). These specific bands, such as 3,450, 1,670–1,600, 1,495, 1,400–1,200, and 832 cm −1 also appeared in the FTIR patterns of the physical mixture ( Figure 6C) and of the solid SMEDDS ( Figure 6D). There was no apparent shift of bands or an emergence of new bands, confirming the absence of changes in the chemical bond formation between the drug and excipients.
